div1.head: Report from Walter Reed to the Adjutant General, July 31, 1901
div1.opener:
All communications to this Office should be addressed “To the Surgeon General, U. S. Army, Washington, D. C.”
Subject: Report of Station and Duty.
WAR DEPARTMENT,
SURGEON GENERAL'S OFFICE,
U. S. ARMY MEDICAL MUSEUM AND LIBRARY,
Corner 7th and B Streets S.W.,
Washington, July 31, 1901 , 189 .
To the Adjutant General,
U.S. Army.
Sir:
div1.p:
I have the honor to report that during
the month of July, 1901, I have been on duty
in the Surgeon General's Office as Curator
of the Army Medical Museum, in accordance
with Par. 2, S.O. No. 153, dated Hdqrs. of
the Army, A.G.O., Washington, D.C., July
7, 1893.
div1.closer:
Very respectfully, Walter Reed, Major & Surgeon, U.S. Army,
Curator.
